english_translation: Narrated by Ibn Abbas: The Messenger of Allah ﷺ went out to the mosque one day, he found his companions sitting in circles discussing the sciences. The first circle he stood at, he found them reciting the Quran, so he sat with them and said: By this I have been sent. Then he went to the second circle and found them discussing the lawful and unlawful, so he sat with them and said nothing. Then he went to the third circle and found them mentioning the oneness of Allah and denial of all that resembles Him, so he sat with them for a long time, then he said: By this I have been commanded.

english_translation: Narrated by Jabir bin Zayd: There reached me from the Messenger of Allah ﷺ that while he was sitting in the mosque, three men came. Two of them came towards the Messenger of Allah ﷺ, and one went about his need. When they stood before the Messenger of Allah ﷺ and greeted him, one of them found a gap in the circle and sat in it, while the other sat behind the circle. The Messenger of Allah ﷺ said: Shall I inform you of the state of these three men? They said: Yes, O Messenger of Allah. He said: As for one of them, he sought refuge with Allah, so Allah granted him refuge. As for the second one, he was shy before Allah, so Allah was shy before him. As for the third one, he turned away, so Allah turned away from him.

english_translation: Narrated by Abu Said al-Khudri: I heard the Messenger of Allah ﷺ saying: A group will come out from among you whom you will despise your prayer alongside their prayer, your fasting alongside their fasting, and your deeds alongside their deeds. They recite the Quran but it does not go beyond their throats. They pass through the religion like an arrow passes through the hunted animal. You look at the arrowhead and see nothing. Then you look at the arrow shaft and see nothing. Then you look at the feathers and see nothing, and you doubt about the nocking point of the arrow. The Messenger of Allah ﷺ said this hadith about the Khawarij (those who rebel against the true religion). The Rabi' said: The arrowhead is the iron tip, the arrow shaft is the arrow which has the iron tip, the arrow feathers are what the bowstring is placed upon. It is also narrated: You look at the reddish part and see nothing, and the reddish part is the head of the arrow.

english_translation: Narrated by Abu Hurayrah: The Prophet ﷺ went out to the cemetery and said: Peace be upon you, O dwelling of believing people. We will, if Allah wills, soon join you. I wish I could see my brothers. They said: Are we not your brothers, O Messenger of Allah? He said: Rather, you are my companions. My brothers are those who come after me, and I am their precursor at the Pond. They said: O Messenger of Allah, how will you know those who come after you? He said: Do you not see that if a man had white-marked horses among dark horses, would he not recognize his horses? They said: Yes, O Messenger of Allah. He said: They will come on the Day of Judgment with white marks from the traces of ablution, and I am their precursor at the Pond. Certainly, some men will be driven away from my Pond as the stray camel is driven away. I will call them, but it will be said: They have changed things after you. Then I will say: Woe, woe to them.
